Description: The FHIR Observation resource defines measurements and assertions about a patient, including vital signs, laboratory data, imaging results, devices measurements, clinical assessment tools, personal characteristics, social history, and core characteristics.
SampleResponse:
<Observation xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<category>

<coding>

<system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/observation-category" />

<code value="vital-signs" />

<display value="Vital Signs" />

</coding>

<text value="Vital Signs" />

</category>

<code>

<coding>

<system value="urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.861.1.7.2.707679" />

<code value="557395" />

<display value="HXL Weight" />

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="http://loinc.org" />

<code value="3141-9" />

<display value="Body weight Measured" />

</coding>

<coding>

<system value="http://loinc.org" />

<code value="8716-3" />

<display value="Vital signs" />

</coding>

<text value="HXL Weight" />

</code>

<subject>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eMMKGfU7AJS5yjSRNjZdLxA3" />

<display value="Meiko Lufhir Jr., PhD" />

</subject>

<effectiveDateTime value="2017-07-26T17:42:00Z" />

<performer>

<reference value="https://hostname/instance/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eMMKGfU7AJS5yjSRNjZdLxA3" />

<display value="Meiko Lufhir Jr., PhD" />

</performer>

<valueQuantity>

<value value="150" />

<unit value="lb" />

</valueQuantity>

<id value="ejeZM7uM4zxl8gj7D9AqwEvM4HOV.6mxzXCMDzJynl8jllTO7qcPDcDtpwpDoGvQJ2dv.Ddi1YFzyN2wDgbESRw3" />

<status value="final" />

<issued value="2017-07-26T17:42:38Z" />

<method>

<text value="Patient-entered" />

</method>

</Observation>
Remarks: To see an example of how the component.code element is structured for patient-entered flowsheet data, refer to the sample request section of the Observation.Create (Vitals) (STU3) API entry.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: Applicable only to organizations in the Netherlands starting in Epic version August 2021. The site on the body where the observation was made. Used for the location where a blood pressure reading was obtained.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The flowsheet (FLO) ID, encoded flowsheet ID, or LOINC codes to flowsheet mapping. What is being measured.

The code element value varies depending upon what is passed (for example, a flowsheet ID vs. a LOINC code). If using a flowsheet ID, the system value is different between Epic organizations, and it is also different between production and non-production environments for the same organization.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
This element is used for observations filed by patients to patient-entered flowsheets.

Metadata related to the observation.

Represents strict metadata if the coding sub-element is populated. The following strict metadata are supported:

  • 1-UUID
    • The unique reading ID.
  • 2-Blood Glucose Meal Times
    • 1-Before meal
    • 2-After meal
  • 3-Insulin Delivery Reason
    • 1-Basal
    • 2-Bolus
Represents loose metadata if only the text sub-element is populated.

dataAbsentReason.Name: dataAbsentReason
dataAbsentReason.Description:
Available starting in the August 2021 version of Epic.

Indicates that an observation value is missing. Will always be “unknown” for systolic blood pressure values in observations for diastolic-only blood pressure flowsheets, or for diastolic blood pressure value in observations for systolic-only blood pressure flowsheets.

effectiveDateTime.Name: effectiveDateTime
effectiveDateTime.Description: The date and time the observation was taken.

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description: The date and time the observation was documented. This is always the current time.

profile.Name: profile
profile.Description:
Available in Netherlands environments only. This element shows that this API conforms to the profile connected to one of the following canonical urls:
•	http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BloodPressure
•	http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BodyWeight
•	http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-BodyHeight

method.Name: method
method.Description:
Method by which the observation was obtained. Possible values include:

  • "Patient-entered" for patient-entered flowsheet vital signs
  • Applicable only to organizations in the Netherlands starting in August 2021: SNOMED code 10179008 (invasive) for blood pressure readings using an invasive method
  • Applicable only to organizations in the Netherlands starting in August 2021: SNOMED code 22762002 (non-invasive) for blood pressure readings not using an invasive method

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the observation. This is set to amended or final depending on whether the field has been corrected.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The FHIR ID for the patient the observation is about.

valueCodeableConcept.Name: valueCodeableConcept
valueCodeableConcept.Description: This element is populated if the data type is category or custom list. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueDateTime.Name: valueDateTime
valueDateTime.Description: This element is populated if the data type is date. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueQuantity.Name: valueQuantity
valueQuantity.Description: This element is populated if a value has units or the data type is numeric. Only one of the value* elements is required.

valueString.Name: valueString
valueString.Description: This element is populated if a value doesn't have units or the data type is string. Only one of the value[x] elements is required.

valueTime.Name: valueTime
valueTime.Description: This element is populated if the data type is time. Only one of the value* elements is required.
